description.value:
Ghibranis are beetle-like humanoids native to the planet Elytrio (see page 46). After the ghibranis devastated their world with nuclear war, some of the survivors fended for themselves in the wastes, while the rest lived comfortably in a city protected by a bubble of force. The lingering radiation (even within the city) caused a rapid change in their biology, leading to two subspecies: husks, who have lost the use of their wings, and membranes, who have grown idle in their luxury.

Ability Modifiers +2 Con, +2 Wis, -2 Int
Hit Points 4

Size and Type

Ghibranis are Medium humanoids with the ghibrani subtype.

@Compendium[sfrpg.racial-features.M3CbZjuqDmp7SjLr]{Affable}

Ghibranis receive a +2 racial bonus to Diplomacy skill checks.

@Compendium[sfrpg.racial-features.3uLQiM92Tk7hoaDm]{Ghibrani Movement}

All ghibranis have a land speed of 30 feet. Husk ghibranis have a climb speed of 20 feet, while membranes have an extraordinary fly speed of 20 feet with average maneuverability.

@Compendium[sfrpg.racial-features.ivfqMdylivscbLak]{Low-Light Vision}

Ghibranis can see twice as far as @Compendium[sfrpg.races.AMBcyDZDtJ1OOzh3]{Humans} in conditions of dim light.

@Compendium[sfrpg.racial-features.uGMra19HLAK46zhg]{Sturdy}

Husk ghibranis receive a +2 racial bonus to KAC against attempts to bull rush or reposition them.

@Compendium[sfrpg.racial-features.MZdEODXChaRSEwz0]{Subspecies}

Ghibranis belong to one of two subspecies: @Compendium[sfrpg.races.16xEX6CQGCoUqeFt]{Husk} or @Compendium[sfrpg.races.GPRexDoyJb8JCTCs]{Membrane}. All ghibranis start with +2 Wisdom at character creation. Husk ghibranis are more hardy (+2 Constitution) but less imaginative (–2 Intelligence). Membrane ghibranis are more nimble (+2 Dexterity) but weaker (–2 Strength).
